item.title: Keurig Dr Pepper, parent of Peet’s Coffee in $18 billion merger that essentially unwinds the marriage of hot and cold beverages from 2018
item.description: After the deal, the company will break itself in two, with one company selling coffee and the other selling cold beverages like Snapple, Dr Pepper, 7U...

item.title: In the Age of AI, some tech leaders think communications degrees may actually be more valuable than computer science degrees
item.description: Can a two-year ‘problem-solving pool’ solve AI replacing entry-level jobs? This C-suite executive thinks so.

item.title: Subdued FX volatility in August is unusual: BofA analysts
item.description: Increased volatility is expected for the U.S. dollar-Canadian dollar pair.

item.title: Red Lobster’s CEO on weighing the risks and rewards of a turnaround role
item.description: Red Lobster chief Damola Adamolekun explains the career calculus behind saying yes to leading companies in crisis.

item.title: Are sports prediction markets betting or investing? Two new Robinhood lawsuits could define how they are regulated going forward
item.description: Tether has a market cap of $167 billion, but its history of compliance questions puts its regulatory future in doubt.
